Package myGame

Class Settings

java.lang.Object
myGame.Settings
public class Settings
extends java.lang.Object
Settings is where all the game parameters are store. An easy to tweak the game and have fun.
Since:
2019-12-23
Version:
1.0
Author:
Thomas Barillot and MaÃ«l Bouquinet

    • TURN_DURATION

      public static final int TURN_DURATION

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • NUM_ANIMATION_SUBDIVISION

      public static final int NUM_ANIMATION_SUBDIVISION
      The number of TURN_DURATION subdivisions, used for animation.

      This value is in fact the speed of the fastest troop. Due to the way this program is written, this value needs to be a least common multiple in order to make them move at accurate speed. This is why the troops speeds are all powers of 2.

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • ANIMATION_SUBDIVISION

      public static final int ANIMATION_SUBDIVISION
      The duration of an animation subdivision. This value is equal to TURN_DURATION / NUM_ANIMATION_SUBDIVISION.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • PLAYER_DEFAULT_TROOP

      public static final java.lang.Class<?>[] PLAYER_DEFAULT_TROOP
      The troops of the player and NPCs will start with.

      By default this list is empty, but you can add troops this way: {Spearman.class, Spearman.class, Knight.class}

    • PLAYER_DEFAULT_MONEY

      public static final int PLAYER_DEFAULT_MONEY
      The money the player and NPCs will start with.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • NEUTRAL_MAX_MONEY

      public static final int NEUTRAL_MAX_MONEY
      The maximum amount of money the neutral castles start with.

      The exact value is picked at random in between NEUTRAL_MAX_MONEY / 2 and NEUTRAL_MAX_MONEY, for each neutral castle

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • NEUTRAL_MAX_LEVEL

      public static final int NEUTRAL_MAX_LEVEL
      The maximum level of a neutral castles

      The exact value is picked at random in between 1 and NEUTRAL_MAX_LEVEL. This will also affect how many troops they are in the castle.

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • NEUTRAL_DEFAULT_TROOP

      public static final java.lang.Class<?>[] NEUTRAL_DEFAULT_TROOP
      The default troops of the neutral castles.

      The neutral castles will actually have one more random troop for each level above 1.

    • GRID_WIDTH

      public static final int GRID_WIDTH
      The width of the map.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • GRID_HEIGHT

      public static final int GRID_HEIGHT
      The height of the map.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • GRID_THICKNESS

      public static final float GRID_THICKNESS
      The thickness of the grid lines
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • LANGUAGE

      public static final java.lang.String LANGUAGE
      Which language should be used. The available languages can be found in the resources/languages folder.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • CASTLES_SIZE

      public static final int CASTLES_SIZE
      The size of the castles (in grid cells). This value should preferably be an odd number because otherwise, the troops will not be centered with the castle's door when they are send out.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • SOLDIER_SIZE

      public static final int SOLDIER_SIZE
      The size of the troops (in grid cells)
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • MIN_DISTANCE_CASTLES

      public static final int MIN_DISTANCE_CASTLES
      The minimum distance in between two castle (in CASTLES_SIZE).

      The distance is equal to MIN_DISTANCE_CASTLES * CASTLES_SIZE grid cells

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • NUM_NPC

      public static final int NUM_NPC
      The number of NPCs
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • MAX_NEUTRAL

      public static final int MAX_NEUTRAL
      The maximum number of neutral castles.

      The exact value is picked at random in between MAX_NEUTRAL / 2 and MAX_NEUTRAL.

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • NUM_PRODUCTION_SHOWN

      public static final int NUM_PRODUCTION_SHOWN
      The maximum number of production shown in the production menu.

      The maximum number of productions planned isn't bound by this value.

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • NUM_OSTS_SHOWN

      public static final int NUM_OSTS_SHOWN
      The maximum number of OSTs shown in the Send menu.

      The maximum number of OSTs planned isn't bound by this value.

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • NPC_TIMER_TROOP

      public static final int NPC_TIMER_TROOP
      The maximum number of turns before a NPC tries to produce a new troop.

      The exact value is picked at random in between NPC_TIMER_TROOP * NPC_TIMER_MIN and NPC_TIMER_TROOP.

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • NPC_TIMER_ATTACK

      public static final int NPC_TIMER_ATTACK
      The maximum number of turns before a NPC tries to launch an attack.

      The exact value is picked at random in between NPC_TIMER_ATTACK * NPC_TIMER_MIN and NPC_TIMER_ATTACK.

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • NPC_TIMER_LEVELUP

      public static final int NPC_TIMER_LEVELUP
      The maximum number of turns before a NPC tries to level up its castle.

      The exact value is picked at random in between NPC_TIMER_LEVELUP * NPC_TIMER_MIN and NPC_TIMER_LEVELUP.

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • NPC_TIMER_MIN

      public static final float NPC_TIMER_MIN
      This value is used by the NPC_TIMERs.

      NPCs will do some actions at random interval. The exact value is picked at random in between the maximum value * NPC_TIMER_MIN and the maximum value.

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • CHEAT_MONEY

      public static final boolean CHEAT_MONEY
      Gives 100000 gold to the player.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • CHEAT_TROOPS

      public static final boolean CHEAT_TROOPS
      Gives 100 troops of each type to the player.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • CHEAT_LAUNCH_ATTACK

      public static final boolean CHEAT_LAUNCH_ATTACK
      The player will send an attack made of the tree type of soldier, to each other castle.
